skill.author: DasBluEyedDevil

security_audit.summary: This skill documentation describes a legitimate integration tool between OpenSpec and Daem0n-MCP systems. It performs only read operations on local spec files and uses standard MCP memory tools. No security vulnerabilities detected.

content.user_title: Bridge OpenSpec and Daem0n Memory Systems
content.value_statement: Development teams struggle to maintain consistency between formal specifications and AI-assisted development. This skill automatically syncs OpenSpec requirements to Daem0n memory, ensuring AI assistants follow established patterns and learn from past implementations.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detects OpenSpec directories and syncs specifications
Converts MUST/SHOULD requirements to Daem0n rules and patterns
Provides contextual memory when creating new proposals
Archives completed changes as learnings for future reference
Maintains bidirectional feedback loop between specs and outcomes
limitations: Depends on Daem0n-MCP memory system availability
Only processes markdown spec files in standard format
Cannot modify specifications, only reads and references them

use_cases.title: Maintain Specification Consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure AI assistants always reference current specifications when proposing changes, reducing deviation from established patterns.

use_cases.title: Track Implementation Outcomes
use_cases.description: Automatically convert completed feature implementations into organizational learnings that inform future development decisions.

use_cases.title: Context-Aware Proposals
use_cases.description: Get relevant historical context and past failures before creating new proposals, improving success rates.

prompt_templates.title: Sync Specifications
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting work on a project with OpenSpec
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an openspec/ directory in my project. Please sync all specifications to Daem0n memory so I can reference them during development.

prompt_templates.title: Check Before Proposing
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add a caching layer to our API. What do I need to know from our specifications and past experiences before proposing this change?

prompt_templates.title: Archive Learning
prompt_templates.prompt: I've just archived change AUTH-2024-001 for OAuth implementation. Please record the outcome and create learnings for future auth work.

prompt_templates.title: Refresh Stale Specs
prompt_templates.prompt: Our team has updated several specifications. Please refresh the Daem0n memory with the latest OpenSpec changes.

output_examples.input: I want to propose adding a new payment gateway integration
output: Memory Context for Proposal: payment gateway integration
- payments: 'All payment processing must be PCI compliant'
- api-integrations: 'External services require circuit breaker pattern'
- Use adapter pattern for payment provider abstraction
- Previous Stripe integration had timeout issues (worked=false)
MUST: Use encrypted storage for payment tokens
MUST NOT: Log sensitive payment data
ASK FIRST: Is the provider PCI certified?

best_practices: Always run get_briefing() before starting work to enable auto-detection
Record proposal decisions before implementing to maintain audit trail
Archive changes promptly to keep learnings current and relevant
Use specific feature names when querying memory for better results
anti_patterns: Don't manually edit Daem0n memories created by this skill
Avoid creating proposals without checking existing specifications first
Don't skip archiving completed changes - this loses valuable learning opportunities

faq.question: Is this compatible with all OpenSpec versions?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with standard OpenSpec markdown format. Custom formats may need pattern adjustments.

faq.question: What happens if I don't have Daem0n-MCP installed?
faq.answer: The skill will detect missing MCP tools and prompt you to install Daem0n-MCP first.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple OpenSpec projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill maintains separate memory contexts per project based on current working directory.

faq.question: How does it handle spec conflicts?
faq.answer: It creates separate memories for each spec. Conflicts are surfaced during proposal creation for human resolution.

faq.question: What if my specs change frequently?
faq.answer: Use 'refresh openspec' command to update memories. Old versions are superseded, not deleted.

faq.question: Does this work without internet connection?
faq.answer: Yes, all operations are local. It only reads your local spec files and uses local Daem0n memory.
